{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560427,"name":"","username":"wildmustang4903","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wildmustang4903/{size}/263428_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T12:39:29.004Z","cooked":"

Looking for some path planner help.

At our first competition we ran paths with no issue.

Since then, we have implemented pose estimation with Photonvision and are able to navigate the field quite well. We know where we are at all time and are updating our odometry when we see a tag.

However, now we are finding that when we run one of our previous paths, the robot takes off into space. Our field is set up for the blue side (all tags are blue side tags) but it seems like as soon as it sees a tag, it want to drive to the red side of the field.

We think we set up all of our paths on the blue side (though before it did not matter before we implemented vision).

Any guesses as to what would cause this?

Thanks,

It would be easier to help if you could share your code

Its quite hard to tell what is wrong - i think you should log your esimated position and see if there are any weird jumps.
You can do it using advantage scope (as it comes together with wpilib tools), you can find the information for how to log your pose with advantage scope here:

docs.advantagescope.org

ðŸ—º Odometry | AdvantageScope

The odometry tab shows a 2D visualization of the robot overlayed on a map of the field. It can also show extra data like vision targeting status and reference poses.

But having your code will certainty help.

Iâ€™m assuming youâ€™re doing this at home. Are you selecting the right alliance in your driver station? If you â€˜drawâ€™ all your paths on the blue side, and then set your driver station to say youâ€™re on the red alliance (or vice versa) things get wacky just like your description.

You may already know this, but if before you were basically doing dead reckoning and just always starting your robot from 0,0, moving to field odometry puts the 0,0 coordinate (I believe) on the blue corner of the field.

Great info so far. There is deffinitely something like this going on.

The robot knows where it is. We have a graphic on the shuffleboard that shows position on the field and after we disable the robot (because it is driving off the field) it shows exactly where it is in the right spot, but pathplanner is commanding it to go somewhere different tha where we think it should be commanding it.

We are just trying to do a simple middle auto, drive forward a few feet and it immediately start going to the other side of the field.

heres our code on the visionmedgar branch I noticed the problem started to happen after we correct our odometery with Apriltags it kind of starts to freak out as soon as it sees a tag
whatâ€™s strange is that the field position Iâ€™m getting in shuffleboard suggest that it knows where it is just is going somewhere else unrelated to the path
It also breaks out of the pathplanner constraints that are set in the path

When calling PathPlanner to follow a path, you need to pass in a BooleanSupplier to tell it whether to flip the path to Red (or not). Check that you sending a sensible value.

So we did testing last night and here are some of the things we experienced:

  • our auto align functionality seemed messed up, Robot knows tag is forward and left but it runs backwards and right to get there

  • discovered this was inpacted by the initial placement of the robot on the fieldâ€¦ power on facing downfield and its a problem. Power on facing upfield and its not, so related to gyro angle on powerup

  • programmers put is some patches to try to workaround, but still confused as to what was happening and why seeing the tag would not correct it. Robot knows where it is, but drive system acts like it is inverted

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T13:26:42.946Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":21.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496051,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-seems-to-want-to-go-to-the-other-side-of-the-field","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50772,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-seems-to-want-to-go-to-the-other-side-of-the-field/496051/16","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561644,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T13:45:52.499Z","cooked":"
wildmustang4903:

our auto align functionality seemed messed up, Robot knows tag is forward and left but it runs backwards and right to get there

We coincidentally had the same issue during comp, we forgot to invert the driving speeds based on the alliance when auto aligning, this is how we fixed it

boolean isFlipped =
    DriverStation.getAlliance().isPresent()
        && DriverStation.getAlliance().get() == Alliance.Red;

if (DriverStation.getAlliance().get() == Alliance.Red) {
  robotRelativeSpeeds =
      ChassisSpeeds.fromFieldRelativeSpeeds(
          new ChassisSpeeds(-xSpeed, -ySpeed, thetaSpeed),
          isFlipped ? drive.getRotation().plus(new Rotation2d(Math.PI)) : drive.getRotation());
} else {
  robotRelativeSpeeds =
      ChassisSpeeds.fromFieldRelativeSpeeds(
          new ChassisSpeeds(xSpeed, ySpeed, thetaSpeed),
          isFlipped ? drive.getRotation().plus(new Rotation2d(Math.PI)) : drive.getRotation());
}

drive.runVelocity(robotRelativeSpeeds);

^This is a snippet of the auto align command

Iâ€™ve now fixed the AprilTag alignment by making a new drive function I called OdoDrive it should be on the GitHub now.
Instead of using the gyro value as the rotation for the field centric I instead use the rotation pose2d that comes from the m_odomentry object so the start rotation of the robot doesnâ€™t matter.

Another thing Iâ€™ve noticed is that our autoalign command is much more aggressive when called in auto mode compared to when we call it in teleop

I also ran path find to paths in teleop and that worked perfectly fine but when I try to follow a path in auto the behavior described above happens

Iâ€™m honestly a little stumped I will try some fixes tonight see what I can do thank you for your advice so far
